net.pandoragames.util.file

Class ObjectListFile<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.util.file.ListFile
      • net.pandoragames.util.file.ObjectListFile<T>

  • public abstract class ObjectListFile<T>
extends ListFile
    Reads and writes lists of arbitrary objects. This class extends ListFile to support serialisation and deserialisation in a user defined way. This is useful when lists of configuration data should be kept in a simple, human readable format.

    The format to be used for (de-) serialisation is defined by the actual implementation of this class. This allows also the use of arbitrary constructors.

    You should sure consider the use of XML or the serialisation support from java.io package.

    Author:
    Olivier Wehner at 30.03.2008

    • Method Detail

      • loadList

        public java.util.List<T> loadList()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Loads and returns a list of objects from the file specified with the constructor. The list may be empty but will never be null, nor will it contain null entries.
        Returns:
        list of non null objects, possibly empty, never null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read, or if the parse method threw an IOException
        See Also:
        parse(String)

      • storeList

        public void storeList(java.util.List<? extends T> list,
             java.lang.String header)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the list to the file specified with the constructor. null entries in the list will silently be ignored. If a non null header is given, it will be put as comment on top of the list.
        Parameters:
        list - to be stored in the file
        header - optional comment, may span multiple lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be written.

      • format

        public abstract java.lang.String format(T type)
        Implement this method to specify how the object should be formated as string. Note that the returned string must not start with a '#' hash character, as such lines will be interpreted as comments. This method is called from method storeList(). If it returns null, the respective object will be ignored and not be written to file.
        Parameters:
        type - to be formated
        Returns:
        formated object

      • parse

        public abstract T parse(java.lang.String string)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Implement this method to reconstruct an object from its serialised form. If no object can be constructed from the given String, you may either return null or throw an IOException. This method is called from loadList(). If it returns null, the respective line will be ignored, if it throws an IOException parsing of the file will stop, and loadList() will return the exception.
        Parameters:
        string - to be parsed
        Returns:
        parsed object or null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if parsing should be interrupted
